baseline_groups.claim_summary: Competition (duopoly entry) leads to increased use of foggy (complex/dominated) pricing plans in US cellular markets.
baseline_groups.notes: Baseline coefficient 0.314 (p=0.125), NOT significant with market clustering. All 56 specs show positive coefficients (100%), but only 10.7% achieve significance. The effect is significant without market clustering (p=0.004) or without market FE (p<0.001), but proper two-way FE + clustering renders it insignificant.

global_notes: Paper studies competition and tariff complexity in US cellular markets 1984-1989. The baseline result is consistently positive but NOT statistically significant with proper inference. All 56 specifications show positive coefficients. Significance depends heavily on FE structure and clustering choice. did/fe/twoway is a duplicate of baseline (identical coefficients).
